subtitle: This roast is full of flavour, with the lentil mixture being sandwiched with an interesting stuffing.

method.text: Preheat oven to 180°C. Lightly grease a 1.5 - 1 <sup>4</sup>/<sub>5</sub> litre oval casserole or loaf tin.
Heat the oil for the loaf in a large saucepan. Add the onions, tomatoes and apple. Cook gently for 5 min until softened. Add the lentils and blend with the onion mixture.

Add the water, yeast extract and herbs and bring the liquid to the boil. Lower the heat, cover the pan and simmer for 30 min, or until liquid is absorbed and lentils are just cooked. Remove the pan from heat. Stir in oats and the beaten egg. Season to taste. Set aside.
Heat the oil for the stuffing. Add the mushrooms and tomatoes and cook for 5 min. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix thoroughly. Spoon half the lentil mixture into the casserole or loaf tin.
Top with all the stuffing, then the rest of the lentil mixture. Cook in oven for 45 min. Do not cover the container - to allow the lentil mixture to brown and firm on top.

Whilst the roast is cooking, prepare the topping. Heat 15 ml of the remaining oil and fry for 2-3 min, until the crumbs are crisp and golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper. Fry the mushrooms in the remaining oil for 2-3 min or until softened.
To serve, turn out onto a large warmed serving dish, top with crumbs, mushrooms and tomato. Serve in slices.

title: Stuffed lentil roast
